Class GraphPositionDependencies

java.lang.Object
  moca.graphs.Graph<V,E>
      moca.graphs.DirectedSimpleGraph<Predicate,java.lang.Boolean>
          obr.GraphPositionDependencies
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<Predicate>
public class GraphPositionDependencies
extends moca.graphs.DirectedSimpleGraph<Predicate,java.lang.Boolean>

Represents the graph of position dependencies corresponding to a GRD or to one of its strongly connected components.
The graph maintains a hash map to find quickly the vertex corresponding to a predicate and its position. It is used to check the weakly-acyclic and the weakly-sticky properties.

Method Detail

addPredicate

public void addPredicate(Predicate p)
Adds a predicate into the graph if not already in. Note that the number of created vertices is equals to the predicate arity.

Parameters:
p - The predicate to be added.

addEdge

public void addEdge(Predicate p,
                    int positionP,
                    Predicate q,
                    int positionQ)
Convenient method to add a non special edge between two predicate positions. (from the first to the second)

Parameters:
p - The first predicate.
positionP - The first position (it must be lesser than p arity).
q - The second predicate.
positionQ - The second position (it mus be lesser than q arity).

addEdge

public void addEdge(Predicate p,
                    int positionP,
                    Predicate q,
                    int positionQ,
                    java.lang.Boolean special)
Convenient method to add a non special edge between two predicate positions. (from the first to the second)

Parameters:
p - The first predicate.
positionP - The first position (it must be lesser than p arity).
q - The second predicate.
positionQ - The second position (it mus be lesser than q arity).
special - The edge value, if true it will be a special edge.

getVertex

public moca.graphs.vertices.Vertex<Predicate> getVertex(Predicate p,
                                                        int position)
                                                 throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
Returns the vertex associated to a predicate position.
Uses an internal hash map to provide fast access.

Parameters:
p - The predicate to be found.
position - The position inside the predicate.
Throws:
java.util.NoSuchElementException - Whenever a predicate does not belong to the graph, or if the position is greater than predicate arity.

finiteRank

public boolean finiteRank()
Used to check the weakly acyclic property.

Returns:
True if there is no position with infinite rank, i.e. if it is weakly acyclic.

finiteRank

public boolean finiteRank(int vertexID)
Used to check the weakly sticky property.

Parameters:
vertexID - The vertex to be checked.
Returns:
True if the position corresponding to the vertex has a finite rank.

finiteRank

public boolean finiteRank(Predicate p,
                          int position)
Convenient method for finiteRank(vertexID).

See Also:
finiteRank(int)

processFiniteRanks

protected void processFiniteRanks()
Internal method which process the predicate positions ranks. Will only be called by the finiteRank(int vertexID) method.
